intro: Pavetta capillipes, commonly known as the slender pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
